text: in the town that might have lost more
money per square mile than any other in
the country this is called coping I came
down to Palm Beach Florida last month to
see how this weekend retreat for the
very rich was doing during these tough
times Jimmy Buffett has a mansion here
as does Rush Limbaugh in the last six
months this town has been waylaid by the
combined impact of the downturn in the
economy and the Ponzi scheming of
Bernard Madoff who wintered in this
house for years and wheedled hundreds of
millions of dollars from neighbors as
part of his now infamous fraud for the
first time that anyone can recall there
are empty storefronts here and a record
269 homes are on the market once you
learn to spot the for sale signs which
like everything else here are tightly
regulated you realize they're all over a
lot of retailers are struggling like
Stewart dough Pelt a jeweler but it's
never enough I've already gained like I
say the bottom price but you know what's
the bottom I had they want I think they
expect me to lose money a little bit or
to make very very little it's the deals
or not is easy to close as they as they
used to be down the street at a very
pricey clothing store called trillion
David Neff is having a hard time selling
his seven thousand dollar sport jackets
and eight hundred dollar button-down
shirts Madoff was regular here ease wash
linen shirts we're nice for the boat in
the South of France
his color palette was always Navy's in
grades and tans and browns but every now
and then a brighter blue like that neff
also has the last pair of pants that
Madoff ordered which are still on the
racks because by the time they arrived
in the store Madoff had been arrested he
came in and I enjoyed showing him the
special things so I showed him this
trouser he said great I'll take a pair I
discovered that I no longer had his size
but I knew there was fabric available in
Italy I told him that he's terrific get
me a pair unfortunately they arrived
after Bernie left but Palm Beach is a
stiff upper lip kind of place and it's
doing its best to see him alive and well
while the charity galas aren't bringing
in the same huge sums of money many are
still well attended like this one at
Trump's mar-a-lago club which had a
Czarist Russia theme maybe these people
don't know what happened to the last
Tsar
you
